>>    As I said, it is related to test discovery.
> 
> 
> I know,

No, it's not. Early Junit didn't have the noarg constructor, and worked
well. The noarg constructor was introduced in a late 3.x release, if I
remember correctly, simply for the convenience of the developer.

> but you are answering my question by explaining how JUnit's
> implementation works. 

I don't know a single framework for which you didn't have to have some clue
about how it works to do some of the advanced stuff. And Junit really isn't
that hard to understand...

Cheers, Ilja
